description:
In a postapocalyptic world of heavy metal fantasy, the only thing able to save humans from orcs, lizard men, and other monsters is something even MORE evil. Sealed within a 14-year-old boy, the chaotic wizard Dark Schneider is unleashed to fight four mighty generals and their plot to resurrect the evil god Anslasax.

(Source: Viz Media)

Note: The first 13 episodes were released worldwide on Netflix on June 30, 2022, while the remaining 11 episodes released on September 15, 2022.
synonyms: Bastard!! อสูรร้ายจอมราชัน

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Goblin
tags.description: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy. Sometimes with magical abilities.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

node.description:
Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.
He is also proficient in animation and computer graphics.

[Official Website](https://www.tielle.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tielle_official) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0o6gAoBM3HpKhCOYQSolLe) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/TielleOfficial)

Tielle is a vocalist that has worked with Hiroyuki Sawano since 2016. She was selected from the vocal audition of the composer Hiroyuki Sawano. She first collaborated on the single Into the Sky EP, providing vocals for the opening theme of the TV anime Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn RE:0096 anime series. Since then, she has seemingly ceased to continue working with Sawano, after providing vocals for several nZk project.

She started off as a painter in the early '80s, and then switched to photography work. Stopped doing photography when animation switched to digital and nowadays just focuses on special effects.

Titular member of Team Taniguchi, a subsidiary of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) specializing in special effects.

__[Website](http://coldrain.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/coldrain_jp)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/coldrainofficial)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coldrain_official/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4pCVGaLWxDe4d8bsjsnmUM)__

__Introduction:__
Coldrain (stylized as coldrain) is a Japanese five-piece rock band from Nagoya, Japan. The band mixes melodic singing with screams resembling the post-hardcore genre, and while the band are indeed Japanese, all of their songs are written in English. 

__Biography:__
Masato "David" Hayakawa (being the lead vocalist) has a Japanese father and an American mother and speaks both Japanese and English, which is also a main influencer in their choice of pure English songs. After the first two albums, Final Destination and The Enemy Inside, which were only released in Japan, the group made their initial worldwide debut in 2014 with the album The Revelation, released by Hopeless Records and Sony.

After the disbandment of the bands Wheel of Life (where RxYxO, Sugi and Y.K.C used to be) and AVER (where Masato and Katsuma used to be), coldrain was formed in Nagoya, Japan with Masato David Hayakawa on vocals, RxYxO (otherwise known as Ryo) on bass guitar, Katsuma on drums, and Y.K.C (Yokochi) and Sugi on guitars. The common musical interest of the members was one of the decisive factors in the formation of coldrain. Once, when AVER and Wheel of Life first co-debuted on stage, and AVER heard Sevendust's song played during Wheel of Life's rehearsal, an excited Katsuma asked RxYxO, "Don't tell me you're a fan of Sevendust as well!?" Thereafter, each time they interacted, they wanted to form a new band together. RxYxO was originally doing vocals, but became a bassist because of coldrain. The band gained their first followers from performing as a local band in their home-town while distributing demo discs after each performance.

__Members:__
• **Masato** - [Masato David Hayakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/150858), born December 17, 1986 (Songwriter, composer and main vocalist)
• **Y.K.C** - [Ryo Yokochi](https://anilist.co/staff/150861), born November 7, 1982 (Lead guitarist, programmer and pianist)
• **Sugi** - Kazuya Sugiyama, born April 3, 1982 (Rhythm guitarist, baritone guitarist and backing vocalist)
• **RxYxO** - Ryo Shimizu, born March 12, 1983 (Bass guitarist and backing vocalist)
• **Katsuma** - Katsuma Minatani, born March 18, 1987 (Drummer and percussionist)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/diegolima/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/diegolima_) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/diegolimadub)

Diego Lima is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Logan Mitchell (Big Time Rush)
- Sebastián "Sebas" Langarica (Rebelde 2022)
- Paul Randolph (Ginny & Georgia)
- Daring Charming (Ever After High)
- David Corenswet (The Politician and Twisters)
- Mr. Benjamin Mazzara (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Ramiro Ponce (Soy Luna)
- Kamotarō Itō (Gintama 2: Rules are Made to be Broken)
- Obito Uchiha / Tobi (Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 and Naruto X Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections)
- Konohamaru Sarutobi (Naruto X Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections)
- Toneri Ōtsutsuki (Naruto X Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections)
- Gil (Descendants franchise)
- Beyonder / Narrator (Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur)
- Amadeus Cho / Hulk (Marvel's Spider-Man 2017)
- Felix Carlucci (The Walking Dead: World Beyond)
- Theodore "Theo" Decker (The Goldfinch)
- Joe Hunt (Billionaire Boys Club)
- Jason Skolimski / Jason Lennon / The Ogre (Gotham)
- Moon (Pa, Pam, Kapow!)
!~

Voice actress and dubbing director at Iyuno Poland, TransPerfect Media Poland and Film Factory Studio.

Wife of [Krzysztof Cybiński](https://anilist.co/staff/218965/Krzysztof-Cybiski). Mother of [Kacper](https://anilist.co/staff/310060) and [Olga](https://anilist.co/staff/318554) .

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bartekfouquet?igsh=N2ZvbHF3eXVhOWU4) | [Twitter](https://x.com/BartekFukiet) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/bfukiet/) | [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/bartekfukiet/?originalSubdomain=pl)

Besides translation, he works or has worked in film production, distribution and marketing.
Audio Engineer at TransPerfect Media Poland.
He is also proficient in animation and computer graphics.
